component.description: A drop-down menu from which the web application user may make at most one choice.

property.description: Flag indicating that the form should be submitted when the value of the component changes.

If this flag is set to true, then selecting an item from this component will cause the application to navigate using the DropDown's value as the action. Use this in place of defining the navigation outcome using the action MethodBinding. This applies only if submitForm is true.

property-extension.short-description: Navigate using the action represented by the selected value (submitForm property must be True)

property.description: If this flag is set to true, then the component is always rendered with no initial selection.

property-extension.short-description: Display the component with no initial selection

property.description: Method binding representing a method that receives action from this, and possibly other, components. The Action Listener is invoked only when submitForm is true.

property-extension.short-description: Method binding invoked when an action occurs on this, and possibly other, components (submitForm property must be True)

property.description: Method binding representing a method that processes application actions from this component. This attribute is only referenced when submitForm is true.

property-extension.short-description: Method binding invoked to process an action on the component (submitForm property must be True)
